Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Good For The Price
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Depree
Reviews.Content: July 13, 2013, UpdateI have taken more photos since writing the initial review and am even more impressed with this little camera now than I was then.  I am amazed how clear and sharp the photos are right out of the camera.I can't do as much with this camera as I can with my Canon 60d DSLR. The latter has much better zoom capability, is much better for action shots, etc., but it costs many times more than this one so you would expect it to do more.  However, for the typical family shots and street photography, this camera is a much closer second place to the 60d than I realized when I wrote the first review.And the fact that you can carry it in your pocket, always ready for use, is a huge plus.  I now find myself using this camera for family activities much more than I do the 60d.********************************************************************************************My present primary camera is a DSLR Canon 60d.  However, with its lenses, it is much too large and heavy to carry wherever I go when I am out and about.  I wanted a small camera I could carry in my pocket, one that took very good photos and did not break the bank. The Coolpix S3500 fills that need very nicely.Compared to my Canon 60d. which cost many times more what I paid for the S3500, it is a 2 or a 3.  But considering what you get for your money, the S3500 is a strong 5.The photos are clear and sharp, the colors (I have it set in "standard") are very natural appearing, and it handles "noise" up to ISO 1600 about as well as any camera.At ISO 100 & 200 there is negligible noise and an increasing amount thereafter.  But even at 1600 the noise removal software I use cleans up the photo as easily as it does my Canon 60d.  Quite surprising for a camera of this price.This camera has just about anything anyone could want for casual photography.  And it takes good photos.One thing I especially like is that it uses standard SD cards.  I'm using an 8GB card so that I will have space if I want to shoot some video.  The greater capacity of the card, the more photos and video clips it will hold.Also, both surprising and welcome, is the 7X optical zoom.  Typically cameras of this type, even more expensive ones, have an optical zoom of only 4X or 5X.(Note: This camera, like virtually all others, has both optical zoom capability and an option of digital zoom.  My advice is to make use of the optical zoom of 7X and turn off the digital zoom since all that does is to crop the photo to make the subject look larger.  With the optical zoom you can  actuallyincrease the size of whatever you are shooting.)A Quick Start guide comes with the camera.  Don't be fooled by the thickness of the book, there are only a few pages in English.h  The rest of the book is repeating the same basic information in 3 other languages.2 DVD's come with camera.  One, and the most important to me, was the user manual.  It too includes 4 languages, but you can download and save the language portion that you want. It is well done and I recommend using it when you set up the camera rather than the very basic quick start guide.  Don't install everything on your computer, just the portion in the language of your choice.The second DVD gives you tools for processing, printing, and uploading to Facebook your photos.  I didn't install it because I have other software that I use.Also in the box are a hand strap, battery, and charging device, there is no SD card, but the camera does have 25MB of internal memory that will allow you to take a few photos while you get an SD card, and no case.  You charge the battery when it is in the camera using the cable.If you are looking for a small, relatively inexpensive camera for family photos and other casual shooting, this camera deserves very serious consideration.  I'm glad I chose it even though I thought I would never own any brand except Canon.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Christine Belli
Reviews.Content: The camera exceeded my expectations. I actually was able to take pictures of people moving without the picture coming out blurry. Also the quality of the picture is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: What a Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: BarbM
Reviews.Content: I must have been one of the very few hold outs for getting a digital camera, but since it has become nearly impossible to find a film developing establishment, I decided now is the time to take that leap.Just got this little gem and have been getting acquainted with all its features.  For it's size, it seems to do just about everything except wash windows.  Very impressed.  The set up was easy and for me a pretty low learning curve was involved to get the camera in working order...Do like how easy it is to set the exposure and also to be able to turn off the flash.  Zoom and wide angle settings are excellent, and I really do like the ability to take Macro shots.  So far my captures have sharp detail.The only draw back I can see at this point is someone with large hands (a big guy perhaps) might find the function buttons difficult to manipulate since they are on the small side.  That aside, if you are a casual photographer and are in the market for a digital camera, this is one heck of a camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon cool camera
Reviews.Author: Bajan NY
Reviews.Content: Easy-to-use, takes wonderful photos and I love the color. I got this for my aunt and it has made her photos look like a professional :)

Reviews.Title: VERY cool!
Reviews.Author: Karyn M. Khare
Reviews.Content: Very easy to learn to use, slipped memory card and batteries in, turned it on and I was shooting pictures. Having fun zooming in and out. Love the purple color and slim profile. Fits well even in the smallest purse. Will go everywhere with me. I recommend this for anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great addition to photography
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: The size and portability of this camera is really the main reason for buying it.  It takes fantastic pictures and is so small it is not noticeable unless you use the flash.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Product and terrible customer service
Reviews.Author: M. Thompson
Reviews.Content: After 5 weeks, my camera stopped working (lens wouldn't open). I sent it in, and received an email that the work would be covered by warranty. All good. Then, I received an email saying the camera was damaged and repair wasn't covered. I called and told them it had been returned in new condition--they agreed to send a picture (I thought maybe damage had occurred in shipping). They sent a photo showing a tiny scuff mark on the back of the camera and said due to that, it wasn't covered. It makes no sense and has nothing to do with the motor to the lens going out. I never dropped or damaged the camera, but guess what the cost is to repair? Exactly the same as a new camera. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. I thought NIkon was a reputable brand, but this smacks of fraud. Also, the pictures it took before breaking were not high quality and often blurry.

Reviews.Title: Sorry,tried them twice...
Reviews.Author: Mulder
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 coolpix digital camera's over the last 3 yearsand the same problem has occured to both of them. In one the lens is stuck opening and closing and the other most recent one is stuck in the open position. So I guess if you want to spend about $100 ever 1 1/2 on one before it gets stuck then so be it. They are not fixable and now I have to order another camera but not by Nikon. Sadly it took great pictures but I have to move on to another product.

Reviews.Title: Accidently ordered 2, kept both.
Reviews.Author: Alyson-Jo M McCulley
Reviews.Content: I previously owned a Nikon Coolpix and loved it.  One day it just died.  this is a wonderful replacement.  Accidently ordered 2 and intended to send one back.  My husband looked at my pics and decided he wanted it because it has a much better photo quality than the camera he was using.

Reviews.Title: Bought for older parents
Reviews.Author: Lmc
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my parents, who are in their early 60's. They are not what you would call 'early adapters' and wanted something that was simple to figure out. This camera is great for quick picture taking and sharing, and definitely meets their needs. They have been really happy with the picture quality and ease of use. I have yet to hear any complaints that they cannot figure it out!

Reviews.Title: Not working correctly.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "vamp"
Reviews.Content: When first receiving this, I thought the photos were on a delay when taking a photo, but continued to use it thinking it would get better. It's gotten worse. Every photo is blurry, it wont focus and now the lens won't open all the way at times. It very frustrating. Now I have to see if I can get my money back.

Reviews.Title: This small camera packs a punch....It takes absolutely beautiful photographs!
Reviews.Author: C. Galvin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for her birthday.  She is constantly taking pictures and loves posting pictures for friends and family online and always wants her pictures to be perfect.  This camera takes absolutely amazing pictures!  They are so clear and crisp, it seems as if you're looking at the real person or object, not just a photograph.  I also love the fact that you can edit photos right on the camera itself.  Also, the panoramic ability is a lot of fun and works perfectly.  It is such an easy camera to use that she was able to take it out of the box, charge it up, and start taking pictures immediately without having to even read any instructions!!  It's also a very small camera and easily fits into your pocket or purse so you always have it ready to go.  I would highly recommend this product to photography enthusiasts of all ages!!

Reviews.Title: Slow and low quality
Reviews.Author: Jeter's mom
Reviews.Content: I am very disappoint this camera. It is very slow when you want to take another shot. And the picture quality is poor. No matter the setting I tried. I would like to return it even I won't get any penny back. Unfortunately, when I realized the picture quality after I saw the picture from my PC, the return window was already expired.

Reviews.Title: Hardware failed
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: The image sensor on this camera died on me after two month's of use.  Nikon refuses to honor the warranty.  Beware.

Reviews.Title: Slow
Reviews.Author: T-Town Punk "TTP"
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera for a few weeks and have taken many pictures.  I am disappointed with the camera's speed as it is very slow and I must wait too long between shots, often missing the moment.  I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for making videos....
Reviews.Author: Kiwi
Reviews.Content: My old digital camera is about 7 years old. It still works fine, but it doesn't shoot video and it still uses batteries; batteries that need to be replaced every time I pick it up. UGH ! I needed a camera which shoots video as I need to tape sessions for my instructor, so I decided on this little purple gem. I'm glad I did. One of the best things about it is that it has a rechargeable battery which doesn't need replacing !Both the photos and the videos come out lovely. (I'll put up a photo of my dog in the customer photo section, if they still allow that) The photos are clear, lifelike and lit well. The camera comes with a good instruction book and a USB cable and you have the choice to download their photo software if you wish. It's a nice overall package for a very low price and if you're working with a budget, this would be a wise choice. I bought the Transcend 32 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card to go with it as I need Fast, Fast, Fast and I want enough power to see me through any video session I tape. If you're going to shoot video over 20-30 minutes, you'll want more GBs.This Nikon COOLPIX supersedes my needs and I absolutely love it. I look forward to many years of creativity and love from this camera. Thanks, Nikon for making an affordable yet precise tool for our enjoyment. It makes all the difference in the world. Highly recommended for the casual photo enthusiast.

Reviews.Title: not recommended
Reviews.Author: M.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because it was compact and lightweight. Unfortunately, I have to agree with the other negative reviews. I'm a pretty good photographer and every picture came out slightly blurry, even the few I took of still objects. The shutter is also extremely slow and would not work well in high speed or multiple photo situations as there is a big lag. Not sure what the problem was as I tried several different photos and formats. I ended up returning the camera and getting a Canon.

Reviews.Title: delay
Reviews.Author: KRISTIN EMERSON
Reviews.Content: There is a long delay before the camera takes the picture. I have small children and almost all of the time they have moved before the camera will take the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I love my Nikon COOLPIX 3500.  The functions are very easy to use and it takes clear sharp pictures. I recently took pictures of fireworks and they turned out awesome! I would recommend this friends and family.

Reviews.Title: VERY Slow, HORRIBLE photo quality
Reviews.Author: chels_21
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid photographer, in no way an amateur, and have owned many cameras over the years. I probably upgrade about once every 1-2 years. I chose this one because it was under a hundred bucks which was a great price. I also liked the upgrade from my 16 megapixel to this 20 megapixel. However, this is the SLOWEST camera I've ever used! It takes 10-15 seconds between pictures to be able to take another one, which almost defeats the purpose of taking a picture. After taking another reviewer's advice, who suggested using a name brand or higher quality memory card might fix the problem with the slowness, it DID help with that issue a little bit. It at least made the wait time between photos a little less frustrating.After using this camera at Thanksgiving this evening, between all the trouble I had taking the photos to begin with and after getting home and seeing the photos on my computer, I just had to come back here to downgrade my original 3 star rating to a 1 star. We took photos outside around sunset, while there was still plenty of light. Between me and several other people using the camera, every person had issues with it not only being slow, but all the photos kept coming out blurry. Flash on, flash off, it didn't matter (I've never had a camera that took blurry photos with the flash on!). I tried several different settings- auto mode, indoor mode, night mode, sunset mode- the quality of the photos stayed about the same. I just could NOT get them to stop turning out blurry, and everyone was so frustrated we just gave up on taking photos altogether. After putting the photos on my computer, the quality of the photos was surprisingly horrible. They were very blurry, grainy, and either too flashy or too dark. The photos I cropped to bring the subjects of the photos in closer looked like the quality of photos my phone takes! On top of that, the 1 or 2 photos that managed to come out decent enough not to delete had white spots all over the photo- like water spots, or "ghost spots." Very disappointing :(.This was my first try at owning a Nikon, and I can say with certainty I will never be owning one again. I will be reselling this one and I have ordered a Canon to replace it, which I should have done to begin with. I honestly don't think this camera is worth giving a try, even if you get it at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: The best little camera yet
Reviews.Author: Karen King
Reviews.Content: This camera takes such sharp clear pictures even at high zoom.  Lots of options and ways to change your photo look.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Ron Sharpe
Reviews.Content: First, how it arrived.  it came by USPS, in the original box etc., inside a box way too big with no packing material, so the original box bounced around inside the larger box...not a great way to ship.  Second, the camera does blur on low light, speed shots.  Third, the book doesn't tell you the type of sdhc memory card to buy.  I opted for a 32 Gb Sony mini sdhc with an adapter, it is class 10 (important) uhs-1 (ultra high speed- important) that has a write speed of 40 Mb/sec and read of 50 Mb/sec., believe me there are lots of cards out there that are lot slower and you could be waiting for recovery time to take the next picture or waiting forever to upload what you have taken (you'll get a little over 5K 20.1 M/p pictures with 32 Gb, and little more than 2 hrs HD video), so make sure you get a fast SDHC card!!  Then you won't be blaming the speed on the camera!!  I've take a couple pictues with the internal memory (only get about 4 with 25 Mb internal memory) so don't expect much,  think of the internal memory as buffer.  With the SDHC C10 UHS-1 card installed, the shooting was much better and way faster.  The pictures so far are fairly decent, experimented with some of the setting with different results some good, some bad.  Since I just got the camera a day and a half ago zI have a lot more playing to do with it and will continue with the review later.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: -shipping was super fast as usual-the color is a vibrant red,  lightweight slim design not bulky. Picture clarity is great with editing options available on camera. Very affordable and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Made as Cheap as possible
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I hike every weekend and go through a camera every 2 years taking photos of nature and other hikers. First off this camera is made out of thin ABS Plastic to look like metal. No removable battery. The USB port cover will break soon. The Pictures are so bad I rarely bother now. It takes several seconds between shots so if you don't get an action shot on the first try, you can forget about it. You can not lock focus on objects from afar. Zoomed photos look like crap.I can not imagine a much worse camera at any cost. My last compact camera was a Panasonic with Nikon lense. It was 100X better than this.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: K. White "buyer"
Reviews.Content: I had a CoolPix s200, so this is a real step up.  I cannot adjust the exposure manually, but, hey, it's just a point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price, but I'd pay more to get a better camera
Reviews.Author: Daneel Law "D. Law"
Reviews.Content: There are some Pros and Cons with this camera, and while generally I found it to be a pretty good camera for the price, as a camera it is just okay.Pros- Easy to operate- A good number of still image features for a budget camera- Good resolution for still images and some nice settings to play with- Compact and convenient to carry- Up to 32GB SD card- Video image stabilization is reasonable- 7x optical zoomCons- Panorama mode is basically worthless.  I got better panoramas off my Samsung phone- Video quality is poor in anything but daylight, and does not record in full HD, and video options are very limited- On camera light for video tends to blind subjects- Proprietary USB port on the camera means you have to use the Nikon cable- Low light photographs are poor quality, even at higher ISO settings- No optical zoom on video modeConclusionFor a day out or vacation where you'll be doing mostly still shots, it's not a bad camera for the price.  If you plan to do a lot of low light photography, panorama or video, you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Ida M.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the high megapixel count fool you into thinking that this is a great, cost effective buy. I read reviews that this is a great camera for low lighting, which is absolute bull. It would take blurry photos even in perfect conditions. I wanted a relatively cheap, compact purse camera to have on hand when I don't want to carry around my DSLR, but this camera was absolutely not the solution. The price should be about $75 instead because that, to me, is the accurate value. I ended up returning it and opting for Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX7. The Coolpix S3500 over-promised, under-performed. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Took to long to take photo...not practical for taking photos of our little kids or action shots.
Reviews.Author: Brian J McInerney
Reviews.Content: We have used Canon cameras for years and got great pictures, but after dropping and breaking a second camera we decided to try Nikon.  We tried multiple settings, holding and not holding the flash, and EVERY picture took too long to take and ended up blurry.  Not practical for taking pictures of little kids!  We retuned it and got another Canon instead.

Reviews.Title: Did not make the cut, had to return it.
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: Blurry pics, slow to take pictures, lens got stuck and would not shut down, returned before the 90 days ended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: Bought this for an overseas trip.It takes great pictures and if you take a little time to understand the modes it is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, but not for me.
Reviews.Author: dsnake
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a small camera that I can run around with at festival, concerts, etc. It takes ok pictures, but it doesn't take much movement for a shot to come out blurry. Plus the camera just takes way too long to take multiple shots. The delay is maddening. The pictures I took my time on turned out pretty good though. My overall opinion... meh.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Quality!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ahmir Khan
Reviews.Content: Within a few days of using this camera, the shutter would get stuck, additionally, there a thin metal piece that surrounds the lens was coming apart...It was a great price, but not worth it considering the camera wouldn't closeI should have believed the other reviews!!!I will say, though, Amazon is awesome, they accepted the return with return shipping and full refund!!!!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: crb
Reviews.Content: Very simple and magnificent piece of equipment ! Great large lcd screen and long battery life Thanks Nikon! And Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Amazing pictures!
Reviews.Author: KellyK
Reviews.Content: Last month I spent 2 weeks in Italy. I bought this camera at the last minute as a backup to my iPhone and for the museum mode. I didn't want to spend a lot of money, so the price point was perfect for the features offered.  As it turned out the Nikon took such great pictures it became my primary camera. I used most of the modes and the zoom and wide angle.  I especially liked the wide angle shots which I could not get on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Great Little camera !
Reviews.Author: Rose Register "rosyposey"
Reviews.Content: It is so easy to use and wonderfully clear, sharp pictures! :) The image of a double rainbow that I took the other day was so impressive !The price and colors are great  too.The only negative thing is that the battery comes loose easy - the little plastic click doesn't do its job.Overall, it's still the best camera I have; over my Kodak and Cannon ones.

Reviews.Title: Nice but grainy
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: I admit that I am a camera snob and have high expectations for any camera that I buy.  That said, I have long respected Nikon and the SLRs that they make.  When my husband purchased this camera for me as a Mother's Day gift, I was thrilled.  I wanted a small point and shoot camera to take with us just out and about instead of our SLR.  I have a steady hand and am experienced at playing with settings on digital cameras.  I tried MANY different settings including the "sports" setting and even in nice daylight, the camera couldn't keep up with my toddler and 9 month old.  Almost all of the pictures were blurry, and those that weren't, were very grainy once put onto a computer.  Sadly, when printed, my iphone produced better quality 4x6 pictures.  The on camera editing features are very cool and the size of the camera is great.  Perhaps if using a tripod and doing stills, this might be a great product.  For people wanting to photograph kids, I would steer clear. I will also add that I immediately turned off the digital zoom since in general, that tends to cause grainier photos.

Reviews.Title: Average camera, watch how you put the battery in.
Reviews.Author: Richard Lee "Richard"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at the end of October.  It is typical of a point-and-shoot camera in some ways, but was inferior in the respect that it does not allow you to take 2 pictures in a row; there is a long lag between pictures.Worst of all in the terrible battery.  This camera has seen very limited use, and the battery won't charge.  After less than 6 months, that is unacceptable, even for a camera at this price point.Save your time and money.  This is not a good product at all.UPDATE: I think I put the battery in wrong, in fairness.  In prior cameras I have owned, the battery only fit in one way.  The is not the case here, so you have to be careful to line up the contacts, which is not obvious, but I think it may explain the problems people have with the battery.  It seems to be working again.The long lag between pictures, and between pushing the button and the exposure, is less than ideal though, that is a fact.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what we wanted, a point and shoot with high resolution. Some other people who rated this camera complained that you had to wait too long before taking a second picture. Well, I discovered that tapping the button on top causes the camera to jump roght back to picture-taking-mode. We love it - don't listen to the people who gave it one star.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: save our country "spread the truth!"
Reviews.Content: Impressive in low light conditions. Pictures are crisp with good color. The zoom is greater than most compact cameras; very pleased.

Reviews.Title: This will be a long review, spread out over my usage.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This will be a long review, spread out over my usage - I know I desperately looked around for detailed reviews while buying cameras and so I will pay it forward by sharing of my experience.11/17/2013: Just got the camera, it looks exactly as its described and on first glance, it seems great. However, on first glance these are the issues - doesn't seem to have a manual mode, unlike my older Canon Powershot SD630 and my newer Canon Powershot SD790 digital elph. What it does have is an 'Auto' mode, a 'Scene Selection' mode with a no. of various 'scenes' such as night, portrait, landscape etc., a 'Special Effects' mode for selecting options like vivid color, high key, sepia, black and white etc. and lastly a 'Smart Portrait' mode where it automatically detects a smile on a face in focus and activates the shutter by itself. (Details on the manual - I am sure you can download it elsewhere). In flash mode, if you set a different color balance other than sunlight, it does not auto compensate and gives a bluish tint if using the flash in other light conditions. The 7x zoom is the prime reason I bought it for, but haven't yet had a chance to fully test it out. More later.12/25/2012I have used the camera for slightly over a month. Pl see the pics I uploaded. The following are my observations:a. Time lag between start-up and first shot is slightly high, compared to my Canon SD790 model. It seems to take some time to focus.b. Again, focus issue - sometimes in the middle of a series of shots, it just seems to get lost. The shutter will need to be kept pressed for a few seconds and released, before it responds and focusses again.c. Not having a manual mode and always having to work with preset settings is quite annoying. Again, my slightly 'dumber' Canon SD790 or the older SD660 had a sort of manual mode that gives more flexibility.d. Picture quality is good, though not noticeably better because of the 20.1MP.e. I have noticed that low-light pictures invariably have shake and blur, even pictures taken on twilight conditions have movement blurs. There seems to be image stabilization (I can see the icon) but have not been able to find a way to switch it on or off. Took some pictures under night condition and was not too impressed with the result. Again, the Canons performed better.f. I used this to take a series of macro shots of comic books that I was listing on eBay. Under daylight conditions, these shots were great (with a tendency to blur), but under artificial light conditions (tungsten/fluorescent) the AWB color correction was off, as was the focus. Loads of blur. Increasing the ISO from 100 to 200 and then to 400 lead to significant increase in noise.g. I honestly don't like the preset scenes and would prefer a simpler way of just taking pictures with auto focus. There is a tendency of over compensating, with excess light (over exposures) and color balance.All in all its a good camera but not an absolutely great one. I feel its a great camera for people who want fully automatic settings, but since I prefer having fiddle room, that's not too good for me.Perhaps I am not doing something right. If so, would appreciate any advise via comments.More later

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: judyc
Reviews.Content: Great camera - just what I wanted.  Easy to use and small enough to keep in one's pocket or purse.  Pictures turned out very well.  Perfect little "point and shoot"!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the smart compact travel getaways.
Reviews.Author: E. H.
Reviews.Content: Small, compact, reliable, great for travel and family occasions. Removable memory card, Good size screen and easy to operate for both photos and video.

Reviews.Title: An average camera.
Reviews.Author: OhioKen
Reviews.Content: The camera is adequate but the color saturation leaves a lot to be desired. The colors just are not true to life and there is no way to adjust the color saturation.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for pictures of products selling on line.
Reviews.Author: Renee Kaefer
Reviews.Content: This camera has excellent picture resolution and is very easy to understand and operate. The pics are amazing. With 20 MP the detail in the photos are great and the zoom close up images are like real life images.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Demoya
Reviews.Content: I was going out of town and needed a camera, this was perfect. I only wish it didn't take so long o go back to camera mode after taking a picture. Well I still love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: The_Mrs_Mac06
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and paid for the fast shipping and received it in 2 days!  Absolutely happy and satisfied customer!  The camera does everything you could want from special effects and zooming to everything in between.  I love the color ~ chose it because pink is my favorite color!  Definitely happy with the 20.1 MP and the 7x zoom... it takes absolutely wonderful pictures!!  Very thin and small, fits nicely into a purse.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Only thing I like about it is it's size.
Reviews.Author: Eb's Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the reviews I had read and the size, along with the MPs.My old camera was just so big and bulky and got so tired of having it strapped around my neck all the time.  Plus it was only 8 MP with a 12X zoom and I wanted more.  (Kodak EasyShare ZD 8612IS)PROS:I thought it had a decent price on it considering all that it was supposed to do plus I bought the SD card with it.It is an absolute perfect size to drop into your purse or put in your pocket and take it with you anywhere anytime.The size of the screen.  If you are used to using a viewfinder, this is awesome.  You get a nice big view of what you are shooting, with the box turning from red to green when your shot is ready.CONS;I am by no means camera savy.  I have read the instruction book several times and played/experimented with this camera for hours and like about 15% of the photos that I have taken.  Most of them come out too dark or too blurry.  It doesn't matter which setting I use, whether I use my tripod or just hold it and whether I edit it them or not.  The manual is just not in layman's terms for your average (or in my case, below average) camera user.If you are looking for a "simple to use camera"  this is not one for you.  There are just too many menu screens to go through.  It gets so confusing and you just go from button to button.  It's like a maze!  I got totally frustrated and half the time couldn't even get back to where I was without shutting the camera off.IN A NUTSHELL:I DO NOT recommend this UNLESS you know how to get through a maze of menu screens and are a tech nut.  I WISH I COULD SEND IT BACK but my hubby threw the box away that it came in and my time is almost up anyway.  I would rather use my good ole KODAK, at least I can get pictures that are good and clear with it!

Reviews.Title: So Far
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: So far so good,love the color and design,the price is amazing.and its super easy to learn so definitely give it a try

Reviews.Title: Returned item
Reviews.Author: Joann Sprouse "Grandma Jo-Ann"
Reviews.Content: Looks great---good shipping but for me the buttons on the camera are too small and that would make it too difficult to use.

Reviews.Title: Something to get use to.
Reviews.Author: Kenisha Wills
Reviews.Content: I have to get more familiar with the settings but the picture quality is great for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Decent Over-all Camera
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: This seemed to be a fairly decent over-all camera. I also have a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W730 16.1 mega pixels. I was hoping to improve scenery shots with the 20 mega pixel Nikon. The same picture taken side by side with each camera were no comparison. The Sony pictures were 100% better in all aspects, clarity, detail, color, etc. I returned the Nikon the same day. Also I believe the Sony is a little more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Hit and Miss
Reviews.Author: Bruce Corneil
Reviews.Content: An attractive, easy to use and reasonably priced pocket camera. That's the good news.Unfortunately, the photo quality varies considerably. Sometimes it's quite OK. But, all too often it's decidedly soft and mushy. Of course, you can beef up the contrast and sharpen the detail using the photo editing program on your PC. However, you really shouldn't have to do all this just to get decent, basic snaps. Indeed, the fact that such doctoring is required indicates that something is terribly wrong. Put simply, the camera is failing to capture the true and accurate appearance of the subject.The problem seems to be caused by the Nikon's inability to perform consistently well in changing light conditions and from different angles, even in the same outdoor location during the same shoot.And while you might be able to add a touch of zing to improve the look of flat pics, you'll never know, for sure, if the end result bears much, if any, resemblance to the real thing.In summary : Hit and Miss

Reviews.Title: Pictures better than I need, and movies decent quality as well
Reviews.Author: D. Hannan
Reviews.Content: Like all cameras I use, many of the pictures blur unless I'm using a tripod. However, it seems less blur with this. Sports shots are 50-50. I'm not a professional photographer. I did adjust the picture quality down, as I did not need 8 MB files per pictures filling my hard drives. The pictures are still more than sufficient for printing and viewing on screen. Movies come up pretty well too, considering it's a camera. Lightweight, red. I'm satisfied for family shots and school sports. The flash is easy to disable at those games where there is "No flash photography." The parents with the giant $1K + cameras still take better pictures than I do with this. But, I paid 1/10 what they did, and this fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in Georgia!
Reviews.Author: JBmiddle GA
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in Georgia! Last week I purchased a Nikon COOLPIX S3500 to take on a Disney Cruise! The camera worked great for the 1st 4 days. I went to take a picture and all of a sudden it would not turn on, so I thought it must need to be charged. So I plugged the camera in and nothing happened. I then tried a new plug and still no luck. Bottom line a brand new camera purchased for the trip failed to last 4 days. I have called the store and they will be more than glad to exchange it. Needless to say I will never but another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jae
Reviews.Content: Amazing little camera. The first shot was perfect and it went on from there. We were amazed that such a tiny camera produced such beautiful, crisp photos. Slip it in your pocket and be assured that the memories you capture will be perfect. I did read the extensive reviews, however was still quite surprised at just how great this camera is.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: cut
Reviews.Content: pretty good cam,takes really good pictures.... blah blah blah filler words.lol snap snap some pics and make some memories. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Sheila Rosson
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera to use instead of my iPhone so I could print easy. This camera is great. Takes pictures as good as the big boys. I carry it with me in my purse. Has come in handy. Love it

Reviews.Title: Don't do it.
Reviews.Author: StrawberryQ
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera was not worth it at all. I was excited by 4/5 average rating and got it over Thanksgiving weekend. I have to say it looks very cute and the color was wonderful, but that's where the positives end. I used it for two outings and 95% of my pictures were blurry. The only decent ones were where my subjects posed for at least 5 seconds...very unrealistic especially if you want candid shots. The camera itself is VERY SLOW at taking pictures, especially if you want to use flash, because it takes about 2-3 seconds to just charge the flash before it snaps the picture. After that, you have to wait another 2-3 seconds for the picture to save to your memory card. Most often than not, that picture turns out to be very blurry and disappointing.I was lured in by the 20.1 MP and 7x zoom, which SOUNDS GREAT.... but isn't worth much if the camera itself can't take any good pictures and is so slow. I've had a Canon point and shoot digital camera for around 4 years and it works MUCH better, and although the price for that one was 3x this one you'd think it would AT LEAST be able to take a few decent pictures. Sending it back!

Reviews.Title: So disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Shelley Gregory "librashell"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an older Nikon Coolpix that we had had for years with no problem and that our daughter was now using. At first, I was pleased with its light weight and sleek design. However, with use, these became problems. Not quite hefty enough to be something "solid" and the curving front didn't allow for a place for your finger to curl around and grab. But those are minor complaints. After only two weeks of moderate use, the record, delete and scene buttons suddenly no longer functioned; the zoom took forever to kick in; and the camera took a photo immediately when turned on (I have a lot of photos of feet) but then wouldn't take the picture I wanted a few seconds later even though I'd hit the shutter button several times. It always eventually worked but the "moment" had passed. As a result, my SD card was full of photos I couldn't delete; not fun when you're away from home, don't have access to a computer and have an SD card with limited room. I'm not sure if I just got a random lemon or if this is the way Nikon cameras are going; either way, disappointing and returned.

Reviews.Title: Ok but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Amanda H.
Reviews.Content: It is a very good camera except for the focusing. It has a "Macro" feature, but it will not allow you to get closer than 2 feet away. Any closer and the camera refuses to focus.

Reviews.Title: Slow and blurry
Reviews.Author: AmyP
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of months and wish I could return it. It is slow and takes blurry pictures. I assume that it may be better for set shots, but the primary subjects of my pictures are children and dogs....not good. By the time the camera actually TAKES the picture, the subject has moved. Then you have to wait for the camera to process the blurry picture you just took in order for you to take the next picture. Maddening. I am switching back to my old camera and will be researching how to get my money back. I would not recommend this camera if you are using it for kids. Or anything that may possibly move..

Reviews.Title: Will not download photos
Reviews.Author: HerbHen
Reviews.Content: At first it took great pictures and downloaded them easily.  Then yesterday I tried to download more pictures and I couldn't.  I deleted the Nikon software and re-installed it.  There was no change.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Pamela Brown
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera or a specific trip. I love the size, it fits anywhere you want it to. My only complaint is that there is a long pause between takes. This may be remedied with a faster memory card (I've been told). I haven't tried that yet. The zoom is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Terrific camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: WOODY420
Reviews.Content: I just received my new camera yesterday but within 1/2 an hour after loading the software, reading a little, I was taking professional looking pictures. The camera weights almost nothing for sure less than my wallet, yet it is jam packed with unique features that will make your pictures really stand out from others. I recommend this camera highly

Reviews.Title: great product.wish booklet more detailed re use.
Reviews.Author: david nickola
Reviews.Content: I left on trip day after camera arrived and did not take viewnx2 dvd.dvd instructions hard to follow compared to other systems

Reviews.Title: There are better products out there
Reviews.Author: RF
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera mostly for the increased resolution offered over the one that I had.  The resolution is better but many other features are not as good as my previous camera (about 3-4 years old).  The night/no-flash pictures are not nearly as good (too blurry), and the pause between pictures is too long.  I might be able to play with the camera and change a setting to fix the latter, but I don't like that it's not intuitive to easily fix that (and that the default setting is such a long pause between pictures).  Finally, when I rotate the camera and take a picture, the camera doesn't automatically rotate the picture for me when viewing and uploading.  I got used to that simple feature on my old camera as well.  Bottom line is that it's a decent camera, good resolution pictures (in flash and daylight), and it's well-priced.  I'm not even picky about cameras but this one just didn't have enough of what I was looking for.  I guess I should have done more research (although I thought I had).

Reviews.Title: Cute camera, but lousy pictures.
Reviews.Author: L. Lampa
Reviews.Content: I could not believe my eyes when I pulled the pictures up on my computer.  I was replacing my Kodak 10 mp camera and this camera produced really bad pictures (and I'm not an amateur photographer).  The quality was just not there!  This camera might work for a child's first camera who can't tell the difference between a good picture from a bad one, but don't waste your money.  For a Nikon camera, I was seriously disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, small with excellent large screen
Reviews.Author: bekki
Reviews.Content: Got this for my parents who are very technologically impaired.  Despite their hatred of anything new-fangled (if you can even still call digital cameras new-fangled) they loved this camera and had no trouble using it out of the box.  I still have to show them how to download the actual pictures each time, but at least they can take them and store them in the camera until I see them.  It's a nice, tiny size that my mom can keep in her purse without taking up too much space, but the view screen on the back is huge and gives a great preview of all your pics.  Highly recommended for anyone that needs a basic, run of the mill digital camera for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Hall
Reviews.Content: Well, I don't know what to say. I like the camera, but I don't love it. Sometimes I get great photos, but, other times, the camera falls short. At one point in time I had a Kodak 10mp, which took better pictures. Sure, the image is 'larger', but the quality, not so much. I do plan on keeping the camera, because it is very useful. For the price, it is a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: Has amazing picture quality, very easy to use. Much better than the last coolpix I had! The rechargeable battery also holds a charge for a long time, I've yet to recharge it and I have used it for close to 100 photos over the last month. The video quality is pretty good too, wish it was 1080, but 720 is good enough! It's also pretty good with action shots as well, my 4 month old doesn't sit still, but I've managed to get a lot of awesome pictures of her!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera!  It is thin and easy to carry. Takes excellent pictures.
Reviews.Author: Judith DaBai
Reviews.Content: Camera can be put in a pocket.  The zoom feature brings things so close that you feel you can touch it.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who is traveling on a cruise or bus trip.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: S. Bateman
Reviews.Content: Takes ok pictures in low lights conditions, and good pictures in regular light conditions. It has the close up feature that I was looking for, and lots of other features. Outside, during the day, it takes good pictures on auto, but for most other times you will need to play with the settings a little, that part is ok with we, I usually take a few test pictures before I take any that I care about. Overall a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: bme
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures, even when using the zoom.  Only concern is there is a 3 or 4 second delay between taking shoots.  Battery life is 2 days if you using it daily. Charges quickly. I purchase extra batteries so I would always have a charged battery on hand. This camera fits nicely into a pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Dive Camera
Reviews.Author: Steven B. Merrick "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the availability of a reasonably priced underwater housing.  My last camera could not be shut off without opening the housing, and as a result I would either run out of battery on the second dive, or if I attempted to open the housing to replace the battery, the housing would fog up.  This camera worked great in the housing, taking excellent pictures during my dive in Maui, Hawaii.  I did not use an external flash, and while I was only around 50 feet or so, still was very impressed with the quality of the pictures.  I also used it on the surface portion of my vacation, and it took great pictures.If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive point and shoot that also works underwater, I can recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great for my 8 year old
Reviews.Author: HotRods4Ever
Reviews.Content: Finally a rock solid camera for my younger daughter.  She has been using this since Christmas and it has been perfect for her.  Takes great photos in auto mode and has been robust enough to withstand her wear and tear, including a few drop tests.  The Nikon quality is the best I've seen for the price range and for the ease of operation.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Gilliam
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and it's easy to use. It came promptly, but I noticed this morning that I could have gotten in for half price at Target this week!

Reviews.Title: Cute but doesn't take good pictures
Reviews.Author: Luka Frost "Brecken"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and another one for my daughter for Xmas. She was excited to get both, the other one was a poloroid. After a day or two I noticed she had left her camera on the counter, so I picked it up and started taking pictures with it. I was suprised at how low quality the pictures were. My iPhone takes better pcitures then this camera. I asked my daughter what she thought about the picture quality and she said it was so bad she didn't want the camera.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: ida zombie
Reviews.Content: Love my new camera. product has been on my wish list forever. I have been promising myself an upgrade forever. My last several cameras have been Kodak Easy Share ones and I have had a lot of trouble keeping the battery charged and lots of technical issues. This is lightweight, sleek, charged and holds charge well, takes good pics and video. Looking forward to my next road trip or excuse to shoot pics as a hobby as this is good enough quality to keep me occupied.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: CruiseGal55
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Coolpix. My 1st 1 was an L4. I've had it for 10 years.The only reason I replaced it, was because I dropped it 1 too many times.I am very happy with all the upgrades on the s3500, yet the features are so similar to the L4. It's light weight and easy to use. I love that it is rechargable. The L4 wasn't. Uploading to my laptop is so easy.I got the Purple because I couldn't pass on the price.

Reviews.Title: GREAT INEXPENSIVE CAMERA FOR WORK
Reviews.Author: Anita P.
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  Exceeded my expectations for a work camera.  Not too expensive - works well in the field, takes quite a bit of abuse and still works great.  As always, great shopping experience with Amazon, fast shipping, got exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s3500 camera failure
Reviews.Author: Arisha Burlingame
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for travel.Departed 2days after receiving it. The camera did not work properly from the first try .There is a problem with the color and wavy lines on every shot. Still traveling and extremely disappointed to have no photos. Would not recommend refurb products from this particular company. Had the camera checked at a camera shop and repairs would cost more than the camera if even possible.

Reviews.Title: Loving it so far
Reviews.Author: Shelly Skoog-Smith "Stop Animal Cruelty"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because my old Coolpix finally wore out after almost 10 years. I haven't used it that much yet but so far it's great. Colors are more accurate & photo quality blew me away compared with the old camera. There's still a slight delay after pushing the button but it's better than my old one. Can't wait to try it out more with my quick-moving dogs...snapped one super quickly & it was in focus! Not sure about battery life as I haven't used a full charge yet. And I LOVE the purple color...now looking to buy a case & spare battery.

Reviews.Title: Camers
Reviews.Author: Norma Childers
Reviews.Content: I like this little camera because I like to carry one in my purse and it fits great in there.

Reviews.Title: Small but Large in Quality
Reviews.Author: R. Teel
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas and I just wanted to say thank you Santa. This little Nikon packs a powerful punch when it comes to Quality. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3500 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 7x Zoom
Reviews.Author: Marci
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.  We bought it for our daughter for Christmas.  It takes very nice photos. And purple is the best!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: kathleen gilboy
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my purchase. Always trust Amazon. Never disappointed. Love the camera was looking around and decided  to go with Amazon . Needed camera to take pictures of my grandson

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Eleta K. Parris "AUTigress"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  I was having trouble using a big camera I bought to take pictures for eBay, Craigslist, etc.  I ordered this one, and I get great pictures.  It has lots of features, but it isn't complicated to use like the full size camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: The camera is good size, not heavy and so far takes great pictures. I'll continue to test the camera in different lighting situations.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3500
Reviews.Author: Linda Hammel
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my adult daughter for Christmas.  She says that it takes very good pictures.  It is compact, but for the price, it seems to be a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Superb little camera at an unbelievable price.
Reviews.Author: Mr. R. A. Henderson
Reviews.Content: This camera has every thing both the amateur and more adventurous photographer would need. As a point and shoot it is excellent but with so many other features as described in the 240 page manual why pay more. Highly recommended. Delivery from Amazon was brilliant given that it was delivered during the Christmas period.

Reviews.Title: My wife really likes this camera
Reviews.Author: Michael A Waters
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife for her birthday, and she really likes it.  It does everything she wants it to do.  We took it on vacation a few days later and she has enjoyed trying to work with the special effects.  She never did much of that before.  Battery seems to last a good long time.

Reviews.Title: A pink camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy S. Akin
Reviews.Content: This is a great product the picture is great takes great video easy to use. and oh yes ladies it is pink my wife's favorite color so she got a great all around camera she loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera and amazing color, such a great price bought this for my niece she loves taking pictures and has loved this camera!

Reviews.Title: really not good
Reviews.Author: Hatem Ismail Hamed
Reviews.Content: i've just had my first experience with it in a live concert last night the pics quality is so bad and when u zoom the pics becomes full of pixels !and it takes like forever between every capture..the video quality is superbad and it only record 8:11 minutes per videoi really regret buying it !

Reviews.Author: Daniel Barber
Reviews.Content: Used it twice and the lens broke. Will be returning for a replacement when I get back to the states.

Reviews.Title: Small, lightweight for any user
Reviews.Author: Chad Pickeral "Chad"
Reviews.Content: It is exactly what I was looking for in a camera. A simple and easy to use camera that would be small and lightweight and still look nice. The camera takes good photos with just the auto option and the recording option is easy to use. That makes it great for people who are not as technology savvy or don't really want to spend too much time getting the right settings. It does, however, have some great options for changing the settings for people who do want to take the time to play around. I love the pet mode and the smile awareness options.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing!
Reviews.Author: K. Williams "Book and music lover"
Reviews.Content: The minute I got this camera in the mail, I easily downloaded the software and began using it. I went on a trip and took amazing pictures without reading anything. In the interest of full disclosure, I have had three digital cameras before this one, one being a Nikon D200, but I still believe that the S3500 is super easy to use. It is so small, too, I just leave it in my purse, so I am ready to take pictures wherever, whenever. I love this camera. I would recommend this camera both to the amateur and the professional photographer who wants something small and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: great little camera for our 11 year olf
Reviews.Author: Laura J. Lemm "book loving mom"
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we wanted at a great price point. Great looking pictures and video but battery runs out quickly so have a fully charged back up.

Reviews.Title: LOCKS UP
Reviews.Author: Bradbsl
Reviews.Content: TAKES OVER 60 SECONDS SOMETIMES FOR A PICTURE TO DOWNLOAD ON THE CAMERA AND THEN IT LOCKS UP. SO YOU HAVE TO RESTART IT TO TAKE ANOTHER PHOTO. OF COURSE I SENT IT BACK...

Reviews.Title: Just okay
Reviews.Author: L. Bevilacqua
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. I wanted a simple point and click camera with a great zoom &  hoped to get a better quality picture than the ones I take with my cell phone. Unfortunatly, I think the picture quality is about the same as my cell. My biggest complaint is that it takes SO MUCH TIME to reset in-between pictures. We miss so many great shots of our kids.  It is simple to use tho and may be perfect for someone who is looking to take more still pictures or pictures of nature. I just would not purchase it if your looking to take photos of children.

Reviews.Title: OHHHHH I LOVE MY CAMERA ITS SO SMALL,NEAT AND TAKES OUT CLEAN PICTURES I LOVE IT AND I AINT REGRET BUYING IT FOR MY CHRISTMAS
Reviews.Author: isha lisa
Reviews.Content: NO REGRETSLOVE IT SO MUCH AND THE COLOUR WHERE I WAS ABLE TO CHOOSE I JUST LOVE ITMY CHRISTMAS GIFT 2013

Reviews.Title: OK camera
Reviews.Author: home
Reviews.Content: Outdoor pictures are great.  Indoor pictures are OK.  Lag time is VERY long.  It's an OK camera, especially with the low price.

Reviews.Title: magnificant
Reviews.Author: Matthew K Cyr
Reviews.Content: this camera is all that is says and so much more.  outstand pictures for a small compact item well worth it

Reviews.Title: great, versatile, easy-to-use camera!
Reviews.Author: Chel Micheline "Chel Micheline"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for our daughter- she's only eight, but very interested in photography and we wanted to get her a gift that she'd enjoy but she'd also get a lot of use out of. She's been using our iPhones as a camera for years so we figured a small digital camera (with no apps or phone capabilities) might be a good gift.This is a *nice* camera. First and foremost, it's tiny. The last time I had a digital camera, it was large, bulky, and heavy. This camera is about the size of a deck of playoing cards (but thinner) and much lighter. And when the camera is powered off, the lens retracts back into the camera and is covered, so it can be slid into a pocket without the worry about scratching the lens.It's super easy to use- just power it up, aim, and click. There's a built in flash, optical zoom, plus many on-board feature, including tons of fun filters.My daughter has mastered the camera and all after its capabilities after about twenty minutes of playing with it. The photos she printed out were crisp and clear.After years of using the iPhone as my go-to camera, I forgot how nice it is to have a camera that zooms optically, takes clear photos every time, and has a decent flash. I'm tempted to get one of these for myself since I tend to take a lot of photos and having to take at least five every time with the iPhone to get a clear photo is a huge time waster. At the size and price, it's very tempting.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great little camera at an affordable price...meets all expectations
Reviews.Author: f dundas
Reviews.Content: would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a compact camera with a very affordable price..very happy with this purchase

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Gene A. Whitaker
Reviews.Content: As good, or better, than one at more than twice the price. Was easy to use right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Best value in a compact camera
Reviews.Author: AS_Amazon
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift, so i can't really speak from a user standpoint. But the purchase was based on certain features she had to have, was in my expected price range and free shipping plus it allowed me to redeem my Amazon gift card. No complaints at all so far.

Reviews.Title: All I Ever Wanted!
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: No complaints whatsoever. The item arrived fast and came exactly as advertised. It's a great camera and I use it all the time!

Reviews.Title: It's okay...
Reviews.Author: Joey Harmon
Reviews.Content: It was okay but honestly I just don't like it. Maybe I got a bad one but mine is just very glitchy. In the beginning I would say that it was okay. But now something is definitely wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: pretty  good
Reviews.Author: Denisha Brown
Reviews.Content: it works  really  good  with  flash  on  but  grainy  without  it.  but  otherwise a  good  camera... pretty  color  of  pink

Reviews.Title: Good, not great
Reviews.Author: LAH
Reviews.Content: I love taking pictures, particularly landscapes and family photos. This is a good point and shoot camera. I've had it for a few weeks now and have gotten some great shots. It takes beautiful pictures in good lighting, but I have found low light pictures are less clear than with my previous point and shoots.  It does also take longer to save the pictures and be ready for the next shot. Overall, it's a good camera for the price, assuming you're not looking to take a lot of low light pictures, and can deal with the delay between shots.

Reviews.Title: Nikon still makes some of the best.
Reviews.Author: j. jenkins
Reviews.Content: I'm a confirmed Nikon user.  Back in the old film days I had my own dark room and used a 35mm Nikon SLR.  It was great back then and the new Nikon digitals are just as great.  I was told something a long time ago and it's always worked for me... if you want to buy a computer go to a computer company, if you want to buy a digital camera go to a camera company.  Thanks Nikon.

Reviews.Title: So slow a sloth would think it was fast.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I should have followed the majority of the reviews on here and not wasted my money on this camera!!! I used to do professional photography. I knew I would never get the same speed and responsiveness out of a $100 point and shoot as I had from my DSLR but I had no idea just how slow a camera could be. I didn't like the quality if the preview on the LCD screen. I never could tell if the camera was focusing. Above all the speed was a huge issue for me. Had I not dropped it and completely broke it on the third day of use it would have been straight back to Amazon!  The only reason it got 2 stars is because it was pretty cute and tiny and an awesome color!! It also had some cool shooting modes.  Function wise though it was miserable.

Reviews.Title: Very good small camera
Reviews.Author: Philip J. McDermott
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use small camera. This camera takes good pictures. One word of caution. It was very easy to delete pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very slow , waste of my money!
Reviews.Author: notch
Reviews.Content: Camera is VERY SLOW. 30 secs or better between pictures. It only got a little better dropping the pixels down to 10 which defeats  the purpose of a 20 MG camera. Skip it buy something else. Bought Aug 27 and now cant return it just 8 weeks from buying it on amazon. Waste of $100 !

Reviews.Title: Great Vacation Camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Alber
Reviews.Content: Great camera and was the perfect camera for our trip to Florida.  Easy to use and took great pictures in all conditions.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: Devon
Reviews.Content: The camera is slow and sometimes freezes while trying to take a picture. It's a nice camera, just not too fast for taking a lot of pictures.

Reviews.Title: A Satified Custormer
Reviews.Author: Marilyn K. Raineyi
Reviews.Content: I had a similar nikon before and this is just the right kind of camera for me.  Point and shoot.  With other cameras I had trouble with my pictures being blurry.  This camera shoots nice clear photos.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Steve Hair
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S3500 I purchased was to replace a Coolpix S210 that I carried like a cellphone practically everyday since I bought it in 2008 . It worked for me so well ,until I broke it , that I decided to replace it with an updated model . To top it off the S3500 was delivered to me at a price less than Nikon wanted to repair my old S210 .

Reviews.Title: Works well- Easy to use
Reviews.Author: wendelin
Reviews.Content: I'm not great at finding the technical parts of the camera but this one was quite intuitive.  It takes good shots and the macro works well.

Reviews.Title: Love love love it and so does DH!
Reviews.Author: sdbev
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself.  I take a few pics to help with my sewing (and fitting). I was looking for an easy to operate camera with point and shoot, timer, and  tripod capabilities.  I'm completely thrilled at how easy the S3500 is to operate. I had it up and in use in less than 5 minutes.  The fabulous On-line user manual ([...] answered most of my questions before I even received this beauty.  (the on-line search capability is fantastic.) Win8 recognizes the camera and installs the driver without rebooting. Explorer then displays the S3500 under the local computer; (click) DCIM (click again) and the subdirectories on the SD card are visible.  Right clicking on S3500 displays the battery status and offers other options including my favorite import pictures into my specified directory. One of the features which convinced me to buy the Nikon S3500 is that it charges while attached to the computer.  The package includes a wall mounted battery charger.  The charger is plugged into the wall. Then the enclosed cable is attached to the charger and the camera. Most of the time, I will not need any charging beyond computer time. Due to my excitement, DH became interested.  He wants his own!  I've ordered a camera for him, spare batteries & charger for both of us (B009X6WV3Q  The charger and spare batteries are probably unneeded except during vacations but I have a policy of purchasing what I believe will be needed while I can get it -- not a few months/years down the road when these things are never available.  The detail in 20MP pictures is unbelievable. Can't wait to share with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera.
Reviews.Author: Tyrus B. Foster
Reviews.Content: With the capability of twenty mega pixels the photos can be enlarged and not be grainy. It is very user friendly and easy to operate in all ofg it's modes.

Reviews.Title: Pocket choice
Reviews.Author: C. Alexander
Reviews.Content: I got this because I wanted a small pocket camera. This takes such great shots, has special effects, takes really good videos with audio. I've had fun playing with the zoom. For a small camera, it's a winner. I am not one to use my phone to take pics. Downloading these to my laptop is so easy too. Easy to use for all ages.

Reviews.Title: sweet camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Christen
Reviews.Content: i'm very happy with this sleek, high res camera.  user friendly, very portable and fun.  no complaints!  thank you nikon.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Vincent C.
Reviews.Content: Very good camera generally speaking. The 720P HD video footage is the only complaint I would have. It doesnt seem to be HD, although it very well may be, and I have just gotten use to 1080p. Otherwise this camera takes very, very nice quality photos. 20mp and 7x optical zoom for the size and price is just a steal of a deal. Great job Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality camera
Reviews.Author: R. Michalski
Reviews.Content: A lot packed into this thin camera.  Excellent zoom! Battery seems to last forever. Quality pictures. Not for someone with big fingers though.

Reviews.Title: I'll buy more
Reviews.Author: Matthew Blake Starnes
Reviews.Content: Great camera! My wife loves all the features and the shots we we get! great camera for the price....would have paid that twice for what we got!

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Fixit Guy "Uncle Don"
Reviews.Content: Great as a small camera to compliment my big Nikon.  Previous raters had complained about it being slow and missing shots.  For the price you cannot get a better camera.  If you want several frames per second shooting you need to invest in an SLR.  This camera is not made for that.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: Bea
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, have a lot of fun with it and find it very easy to use.  Very happy

Reviews.Title: Bought one for my brother
Reviews.Author: Mary Hanson "Spock Fan in Sacto"
Reviews.Content: My brother's camera broke so I got him this one for his birthday and he loves it.  It's light-weight, easy to use, and has a lot of great "lens" options and functions.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix camerra
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn Edwards
Reviews.Content: At first I looked at how small it was and decided NO but then my friend helped me go over the instructions as well as to insert the battery, go to purchase a memory card and I am now in business and I love it.  The zoom feature is so cool.  I still have lots to learn but I am thrilled with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: happy with this nikon camera - it does the job.and is easy to carry in pocket or hang around neck.

Reviews.Title: nice product
Reviews.Author: pedro navarro
Reviews.Content: it have a good relation between price and quality. my wife is so excited with it. she takes pictures to everything.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ember Pappas
Reviews.Content: I really like the clarity in the pictures. It has a great zoom. Can be difficult to use and learn all of the different settings. Just have to play with it until you can figure it out. It does have a little longer delay on some settings than others but great cam for the price and YES.. I do recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Shot
Reviews.Author: donjoey
Reviews.Content: I'm really just starting to learn how to use all the features of this great little camera...so far all the pix i've taken are super !

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John Scoble
Reviews.Content: The camera is compact, versitile and is extremely sensitive.  Great lense.  It is easy to use and is always on the ready.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Laura Timpson
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera and it is the perfect color.  It takes a very nice picture and decent videos.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT
Reviews.Author: CHRIS WALKER
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA IS VERRY LIGHT & COMPACT .VERY EASY TO USE AND SET UP . LIKE THE MODES AND SPECIALE FEATURES.

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Small enough for my Pocket!
Reviews.Author: lakefish
Reviews.Content: This camera is small enough to fit in my pocket yet it takes great photos.  I have beentotally satisfied with my purchase of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: EP
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice. Picture quality is pretty good and it could fit in any pocket. Overall, I am totally satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Diane Kropewnicki "Oak Haven Farm"
Reviews.Content: Had a CoolPix many years ago and loved it.  This one come close.  Very small, fits in my pocket, but takes nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For the $
Reviews.Author: Kathy Mochak
Reviews.Content: As a Realtor, I use this camera for taking pictures of homes for sale.  I am very satisfied with both exerior and interior shots.

Reviews.Title: coolpix s3500
Reviews.Author: Jim C. "Harley Jim"
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera, takes great pictures, colors were good and very sharp images.  I would recommend it for its low price and very compact size.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Fish
Reviews.Content: I haven't bought a compact digital camera in years, and have had a DSLR I've been using lately. This camera has many settings to adjust to and even has panorama assistance which is great. The pictures themselves are of great quality. I even zoomed all the way in including the optical zoom and though it appears blurry once you take a picture it is crystal clear. It might have just been what I was shooting though. I did however find out at that distance you have to be extremely steady and not move the camera as you push the button to take a picture or the picture will turn out bad. It is recommended not to go past the digital zoom usually so I still feel like this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: At the forefront !
Reviews.Author: Judith A. Lopez "ravin' maven"
Reviews.Content: 20.1 megapixels is beyond the current standard for SLR/Digital pro cameras. this resolution will give you great enlargements when you want them.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Barbara Knight
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I needed. I can carry it in my purse to use at a moment's notice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kareena F.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I bought the S3300 a year ago and wasn't too satisfied. This camera however truly surpasses its predecessor. The images are much cleaner and love the fun design. This camera is both reasonably priced and functional.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera
Reviews.Author: Dvora
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera I've had that takes a zoom picture with the same quality as the standard setting.  No blurs!  easy to use.  I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3500 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher G. Juett
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this camera, always wanted to own a Nikon and the great price on this camera made it possible, also like the cool colors

Reviews.Title: This is A LOT OF CAMERA for the money!!!
Reviews.Author: loves Angels
Reviews.Content: This camera is WAAAY nicer than I expected it to be! It has a lot of features I wasn't expecting! I have been looking for a camera for several months, glad I found this one! I think you WILL BE HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Aubrey
Reviews.Content: Got it quick and as described! Its an awesome camera with cool features, lightweight, and was perfect for my vacation! Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Terry W. Gallian
Reviews.Content: The camera will be accompanying my wife next year as her and three other mature ladies walk the Camino de Santiago. It had to produce great pics and be very light. Perfect for the trip.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: katiewoosmom
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! This was a gift for my daughter's 9th bday and I have to say I'm impressed!  Great quality photos.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Renee Sandoval
Reviews.Content: Great for video or still pics.  Perfect size fits in my pocket or purse. No more missing the moment. Love the color and filagree design on the front. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: rehabken
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a small Canon that had begun to screw up.  The photos are crystal clear and the camera is light so it's easy to carry along on business throughout the state.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: dr
Reviews.Content: Pretty script on the front. It is easy to use. It takes very nice pics. It is a convenient size.

Reviews.Title: Great Images for a Fair Price
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I've had a lot of experience with digital cameras and it seems they advance faster than we can keep up. I was really happy to see that this camera was small and cheap but actually did deliver some pretty quality images. Granted, like most cheaper digital cameras it's grainy at the highest resolution, but it's a wonderful camera for the money. The zoom is ok except that the macro doesn't work as well as they'd have you believe with a 7x zoom. But, over all, it's a great camera and would be wonderful to take on vacation or for some more artistic shots and not worry too much about what happens if you drop it. (I once had a $2000 digital camera. And it turned out that it was great and all, but at the end of the day I didn't WANT to take it to vacation spots due to potential theft and damage so it mostly just sat around forever, never being used.)

Reviews.Title: this camera is not that worth.. i returned it
Reviews.Author: Rohit
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with a thought that the 7x optical xoom and 20.1 MP wud be a good bait...but it not that good.this camera does not give you a feel of a good camera in your hand...moreover the picture quality is not that goodAlso when I got this camera its lens cover had some issues... it were sticky and one time on closing the lens cover, the lens covers were half closed giving me a feeling that the lens cover  have been broken. I was shifting from Cannon to nIKON...but i wud say that still the photos with my Cannon SD camera are good as compared to this camera

Reviews.Title: Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Tewania Stanford
Reviews.Content: Coolpix camera takes really cool pictures, I enjoyed bringing my memories back from Puerto Rico.I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cute little Camera
Reviews.Author: Pinky "Pinky Bachmann"
Reviews.Content: This camera is cute and can do some pretty cool things. I love the color selector so that the pic is Gray Scale and then you pick Pink (or the color of your choice) and all the Pink's (or color of your choice) POP!! out in the pic. It has several different setting. Came with software for the computer and all the cords. I have had a few cameras in my life time and this is by far my fav!! Small and compact easy to carry and fits in your pocket!!

Reviews.Title: Its really good and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Petros Rakas
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera, its easy to use and it has no glitches. I use it for recording videos as well as taking snapshots! Flash settings are easy to handle and in general the whole menu is very user friendly. I recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a great price for a camera and a professional result!

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the Warranty
Reviews.Author: Mary Gold
Reviews.Content: I have been a customer on Amazon for a long long time....I have never been motivated to write a review until now.I was so excited to get this camera after staring at it for some time before actually buying it.  I bought it in Aug 2013.  In September the screen went black and stopped working.  I sent it to Nikon and they repaired it and sent it back.  Other than taking a few pictures during Halloween I had not used the camera until November.  All the pictures came out blurry and I zoomed in on an object, heard 2 load popping sounds....and when I looked down, the camera had busted!  The camera had literally come apart at the top seam next to the button you push to take pictures.  The zoom mechanism busted my camera that I had just gotten back from repair!!!!  So, I send it to Nikon again.  I send in a letter explaining exactly what happened and they decide that it has impact damage and that's not covered under warranty.
